title: ExcelMODE Function

metadata.description: Learn about ExcelMODE Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title:
Excel
MODE Function

MODE Function
The
MODE
function is a premade function in Excel
content_sections.content:
, which is used to find the number seen most times.
This function always returns a single number.

content_sections.title: It is typed
content_sections.content:
=MODE.SNGL
It returns the most occurring number in a range or array.
Note:
The mode is a type of average value, which describes where most of the data is located. You can read more about mode in our:
Statistics Mode Tutorial
.
Let's have a look at an example where we help the Pokemon trainers to calculate the mode of numbers of Pokeballs.

content_sections.title: How to use the
Type
content_sections.content:
=MODE
Double click the
MODE.SNGL
command
Select a range (
B2:E7
)
Hit enter
Trainer	Pokeball	Great Ball	Ultraball	Master Ball
    Iva	10	4	1	1
    Liam	12	3	0	1
    Jenny	15	1	3	1
    Iben	4	2	6	0
    Adora	10	4	1	1
    Kasper	9	2	1	0

    MODE
Copy Values
It returns the number
1
which is seen 7x times. The closest number to it is
3
and
4
which are seen 3x times each.

★
+1

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code:
Trainer	Pokeball	Great Ball	Ultraball	Master Ball
    Iva	10	4	1	1
    Liam	12	3	0	1
    Jenny	15	1	3	1
    Iben	4	2	6	0
    Adora	10	4	1	1
    Kasper	9	2	1	0
				
				
    MODE

summary: This tutorial covers ExcelMODE Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use ExcelMODE Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of ExcelMODE Function and how to apply it in your projects.
